title: BetGenie UK
summary: A football sports website showing pre-game odds, historical head-to-head data, and prediction models.
background: BetGenie is a football sports insights platform built to show pre-game odds and head-to-head data of teams from the past 5 years. It provides graphs of average stats, correlation data, and a backend prediction model that calculates the chance to win compared to bookmakers' odds.
details: Developed with Next.js for the frontend, Python FastAPI for the backend, and PostgreSQL as the database. Deployed on PaaS providers such as Render, Vercel, and Supabase for seamless integration. Docker and GitHub CI/CD pipelines were used for efficient deployment and collaboration.
work: Led the complete development of the platform (full-stack) while coordinating with stakeholders to ensure functionality.
Created complete design work including wireframes, prototypes, web banners, and logo design.
Implemented backend models for odds prediction and historical data analysis.
Deployed application on multiple PaaS services with Dockerized CI/CD setup.

title: BYK Oxford
summary: A financial consultancy platform offering custom, transparent, and intelligent reporting solutions.
background: BYK Oxford is a UK-based financial consultancy firm that blends financial expertise with technology to help businesses turn complex financial data into actionable insights. They specialize in custom reporting, KPI dashboards, and scalable financial models.
details: The platform focuses on building confidence in numbers with tailor-made financial reports and KPIs designed for each business. Unlike generic templates, BYK Oxford provides clear, adaptive, and decision-oriented reporting tools.
work: Built the frontend in Next.js with a clean, professional UI tailored for consultancy.
Handled deployment across Vercel with CI/CD integration.

title: Handyman App
summary: A cross-platform app to connect customers with nearby service providers using CRUD functionality and location-based search.
background: Handyman App is a mobile application built as a Master's final academic project. It allows customers to find service providers within a selectable range using Google Maps API and manage services efficiently. The app performs basic CRUD operations to store customer and service provider data.
details: Developed using Flutter for cross-platform mobile development, Node.js for backend RESTful APIs, and MongoDB for database storage. Postman was used for API testing and validation. The project followed a complete SDLC including requirement gathering, research, competitor analysis, wireframing, and design.
work: Conducted research and comparison with similar apps to define requirements.
Completed full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for the project.
Designed wireframes and UI for intuitive user experience.
Implemented CRUD functionality for customers and service providers.
Integrated Google Maps API to locate nearest service providers within a selectable range.
